transportAdvice: St. Thomas has a public bus system that connects major areas, though service can be infrequent and routes may not cover all tourist destinations conveniently. Taxis and shared safari-style vans are widely available and are the most practical option for getting around, while walking is generally limited to specific areas like Charlotte Amalie due to hilly terrain and limited sidewalks.

weather.description: Dry and pleasant with gentle trade winds making it one of the most comfortable months to visit.
Consistently sunny and dry with low humidity, ideal beach weather and calm seas.
Warm and mostly dry with reliable sunshine and refreshing breezes throughout the month.
Temperatures begin to rise slightly but conditions remain dry and very enjoyable for outdoor activities.
Heat and humidity increase noticeably as the wet season approaches, with occasional afternoon showers.
Early hurricane season begins with warm, humid conditions and more frequent passing showers.
Hot and humid with periodic rain showers, though many days remain sunny between brief downpours.
Peak hurricane season with the highest rainfall and heat; travelers should monitor tropical weather closely.
The most active month of hurricane season with heavy rain potential and oppressive humidity.
Still within hurricane season with frequent rain and high humidity, though storm risk begins to ease late in the month.
Rainfall decreases and conditions gradually improve as the wet season winds down toward month's end.
Dry season returns with comfortable temperatures and lower humidity, making it a popular time to visit.
